channel.title: Science / Health on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Science / Health on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Researchers Create 3D-Printed Artificial Skin That Allows Blood Circulation
item.description: Swedish researchers have developed two types of 3D bioprinting technology to artificially generate skin containing blood vessels. It could be a breakthrough in the quest to regenerate damaged skin.

item.title: Researchers Create 3D-Printed Artificial Skin That Allows Blood Circulation
item.description: Swedish researchers have developed two types of 3D bioprinting technology to artificially generate skin containing blood vessels. It could be a breakthrough in the quest to regenerate damaged skin.

item.title: Why Former NFL All-Pros Are Turning to Psychedelics
item.description: Research into whether drugs like ayahuasca can mitigate the effects of traumatic brain injury is in its infancy. Pro athletes like Jordan Poyer are forging ahead anyway.

item.title: Why Former NFL All-Pros Are Turning to Psychedelics
item.description: Research into whether drugs like ayahuasca can mitigate the effects of traumatic brain injury is in its infancy. Pro athletes like Jordan Poyer are forging ahead anyway.

item.title: This Blood Thinner Is More Effective Than Aspirin at Preventing Heart Attacks
item.description: Aspirin is commonly prescribed to patients with coronary artery disease to prevent heart attacks and strokes, but a new analysis has found that another drug, clopidogrel, is more effective and just as

item.title: Your Body Ages Faster Because of Extreme Heat
item.description: A study reveals that extreme heat accelerates biological aging even more than smoking or drinking.

item.title: Your Body Ages Faster Because of Extreme Heat
item.description: A study reveals that extreme heat accelerates biological aging even more than smoking or drinking.

item.title: Top CDC Officials Resign After Director Is Pushed Out
item.description: The exodus has set off alarms among staff at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: “My main concern is they will be replaced with puppets."

item.title: What It's Like to Work at a Body Farm
item.description: The scavengers are tricky, the smells are gross, and your colleagues are corpses. But some people—mostly women!—love this job.

item.title: What It's Like to Work at a Body Farm
item.description: The scavengers are tricky, the smells are gross, and your colleagues are corpses. But some people—mostly women!—love this job.

item.title: Climate Change Is Bringing Legionnaire’s Disease to a Town Near You
item.description: This deadly bacteria, which hits low-income people the hardest, was once an “only in New York” problem. Extreme heat is now increasing its prevalence.

item.title: Climate Change Is Bringing Legionnaire’s Disease to a Town Near You
item.description: This deadly bacteria, which hits low-income people the hardest, was once an “only in New York” problem. Extreme heat is now increasing its prevalence.

item.title: The West Texas Measles Outbreak Has Ended
item.description: According to state health officials, a measles outbreak that started in an undervaccinated community and killed two children is now over.

item.title: The West Texas Measles Outbreak Has Ended
item.description: According to state health officials, a measles outbreak that started in an undervaccinated community and killed two children is now over.

item.title: Now You Can Get Your Flu Vaccine at Home
item.description: The nasal spray vaccine FluMist can now be ordered online and shipped to your door.

item.title: Now You Can Get Your Flu Vaccine at Home
item.description: The nasal spray vaccine FluMist can now be ordered online and shipped to your door.

item.title: Eli Lilly’s Obesity Pill Shows Promising Weight Loss in New Results
item.description: In an 18-month clinical trial of the experimental GLP-1 pill orforglipron, about 60 percent of people lost at least 10 percent of their body weight.

item.title: Eli Lilly’s Obesity Pill Shows Promising Weight Loss in New Results
item.description: In an 18-month clinical trial of the experimental GLP-1 pill orforglipron, about 60 percent of people lost at least 10 percent of their body weight.

item.title: The First Widespread Cure for HIV Could Be in Children
item.description: Evidence is growing that some HIV-infected infants, if given antiretroviral drugs early in life, are able to suppress their viral loads to undetectable levels and then come off the medicine.

item.title: The First Widespread Cure for HIV Could Be in Children
item.description: Evidence is growing that some HIV-infected infants, if given antiretroviral drugs early in life, are able to suppress their viral loads to undetectable levels and then come off the medicine.

item.title: States Are Moving to Protect Access to Vaccines
item.description: As federal vaccine policy shifts under US health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., lawmakers are looking to give state-level public health officials authority to ignore federal recommendations.

item.title: States Are Moving to Protect Access to Vaccines
item.description: As federal vaccine policy shifts under US health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., lawmakers are looking to give state-level public health officials authority to ignore federal recommendations.

item.title: Join Our Next Livestream: Inside Katie Drummond’s Viral Interview With Bryan Johnson
item.description: On July 31, WIRED’s global editorial director discusses the world of wellness—and beyond—with WIRED reporters.

item.title: The Grave Long-Term Effects of the Gaza Malnutrition Crisis
item.description: The WHO believes one in five children in Gaza are acutely malnourished, with the health effects potentially lasting for generations.

item.title: The Grave Long-Term Effects of the Gaza Malnutrition Crisis
item.description: The WHO believes one in five children in Gaza are acutely malnourished, with the health effects potentially lasting for generations.

item.title: Measles Cases Are Soaring in Mexico
item.description: The disease has claimed the lives of 12 people in the country this year, with the virus continuing to spread rapidly.

item.title: Measles Cases Are Soaring in Mexico
item.description: The disease has claimed the lives of 12 people in the country this year, with the virus continuing to spread rapidly.

item.title: What Your Nighttime Breathing Says About Your Health
item.description: Once dismissed as just snoring, sleep apnea is now emerging as an early warning sign for serious conditions like Alzheimer’s, heart disease, and depression.

item.title: What Your Nighttime Breathing Says About Your Health
item.description: Once dismissed as just snoring, sleep apnea is now emerging as an early warning sign for serious conditions like Alzheimer’s, heart disease, and depression.

item.title: The Hyperflexible People Who May Help Unlock Better Sleep Apnea Treatments
item.description: Patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome are six times more at risk for the sleeping disorder. Now scientists are studying them in hopes of finding remedies beyond the CPAP machine.

item.title: The Hyperflexible People Who May Help Unlock Better Sleep Apnea Treatments
item.description: Patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome are six times more at risk for the sleeping disorder. Now scientists are studying them in hopes of finding remedies beyond the CPAP machine.

item.title: The Pandemic Appears to Have Accelerated Brain Aging, Even in People Who Never Got Covid
item.description: Stress, isolation, and uncertainty appear to have caused the brain to age quicker for those who lived through the crisis.

item.title: Florida Is Now a Haven for Unproven Stem-Cell Treatments
item.description: In a measure that flouts the FDA, Florida says doctors can give unapproved stem-cell therapies for wound care, pain management, or orthopedic purposes.

item.title: Florida Is Now a Haven for Unproven Stem-Cell Treatments
item.description: In a measure that flouts the FDA, Florida says doctors can give unapproved stem-cell therapies for wound care, pain management, or orthopedic purposes.

item.title: Where Are All the AI Drugs?
item.description: In an industry where 90 percent of drug candidates fail before reaching the market, a handful of startups are betting everything on AI to beat the odds.

item.title: Where Are All the AI Drugs?
item.description: In an industry where 90 percent of drug candidates fail before reaching the market, a handful of startups are betting everything on AI to beat the odds.

item.title: Can US Measles Outbreaks Be Stopped?
item.description: The US almost lost its measles elimination status once. Lessons from that episode suggest it will be more difficult to avoid doing so now.
